thread.title: Canada Exports, Imports Fell Markedly in January

author: Paul Vieira
title: Canada Exports, Imports Fell Markedly in January
text:
OTTAWA—Canadian exports and imports fell sharply in January, continuing a lackluster run of indicators for an economy on edge due to heightened trade-policy uncertainty.
Canada’s merchandise trade deficit in January narrowed from the previous month to a seasonally adjusted 1.91 billion Canadian dollars ($1.47 billion), Statistics Canada said Wednesday. The deficit came in better than the market consensus for a C$2.5 billion shortfall, according to economists at Royal Bank of Canada. The trade deficit for December was revised...
